factoid: I dreamed that Joseph Alexéevich was sitting in my house.
I was very glad in the dream.
I wished to entertain Joseph Alexéevich.
I chattered incessantly with other people in the dream.
I suddenly remembered that chattering could not please Joseph Alexéevich.
I wished to come close to Joseph Alexéevich and embrace him.
As I drew near, I saw that Joseph Alexéevich's face had changed and grown young.
Joseph Alexéevich was quietly telling me something about the teaching of our order.
Joseph Alexéevich told me so softly that I could not hear it.
We all left the room in the dream.
Something strange happened after we left the room.
We were sitting or lying on the floor.
Joseph Alexéevich was telling me something.
I wished to show Joseph Alexéevich my sensibility.
I was not listening to what Joseph Alexéevich was saying.
I began picturing to myself the condition of my inner man and the grace of God sanctifying me.
Tears came into my eyes.
I was glad that Joseph Alexéevich noticed my tears.
Joseph Alexéevich looked at me with vexation.
Joseph Alexéevich jumped up, breaking off his remarks.
I felt abashed.
I asked whether what Joseph Alexéevich had been saying did not concern me.
Joseph Alexéevich did not reply.
Joseph Alexéevich gave me a kind look.
We suddenly found ourselves in my bedroom in the dream.
There is a double bed in my bedroom.
Joseph Alexéevich lay down on the edge of the bed.
I burned with longing to caress Joseph Alexéevich and lie down too.
Joseph Alexéevich said, "Tell me frankly what is your chief temptation? Do you know it? I think you know it already."
I replied that sloth was my chief temptation.
Joseph Alexéevich shook his head incredulously.
I said that I was living with my wife as Joseph Alexéevich advised, but I was not living with her as her husband.
Joseph Alexéevich replied that one should not deprive a wife of one’s embraces and gave me to understand that that was my duty.
I replied that I should be ashamed to do it.
Suddenly everything vanished.
I awoke.
In my mind I found the text from the Gospel: "The life was the light of men. And the light shineth in darkness; and the darkness comprehended it not."
Joseph Alexéevich’s face had looked young and bright.
That day I received a letter from my benefactor in which he wrote about "conjugal duties."
9th December I had a dream from which I awoke with a throbbing heart.
I saw that I was in Moscow in my house, in the big sitting room.
Joseph Alexéevich came in from the drawing room.
I seemed to know at once that the process of regeneration had already taken place in Joseph Alexéevich.
I rushed to meet Joseph Alexéevich.
I embraced Joseph Alexéevich.
I kissed his hands.
Joseph Alexéevich said, "Hast thou noticed that my face is different?"
I looked at Joseph Alexéevich, still holding him in my arms.
I saw that Joseph Alexéevich's face was young.
Joseph Alexéevich had no hair on his head.
Joseph Alexéevich's features were quite changed.
I said, "I should have known you had I met you by chance."
I thought to myself, "Am I telling the truth?"
I saw Joseph Alexéevich lying like a dead body.
Joseph Alexéevich gradually recovered and went with me into my study carrying a large book of sheets of drawing paper.
I said, "I drew that."
Joseph Alexéevich answered by bowing his head.
I opened the book.
On all the pages there were excellent drawings.
In my dream I knew that these drawings represented the love adventures of the soul with its beloved.
On the pages I saw a beautiful representation of a maiden in transparent garments and with a transparent body, flying up to the clouds.
I seemed to know that this maiden was nothing else than a representation of the Song of Songs.
Looking at those drawings I dreamed I felt that I was doing wrong.
I could not tear myself away from the drawings.
I prayed, "Lord, help me! My God, if Thy forsaking me is Thy doing, Thy will be done; but if I am myself the cause, teach me what I should do!"
I said, "I shall perish of my debauchery if Thou utterly desertest me!"
